properties.areaDesc: Hawk Channel from Ocean Reef to Craig Key out to the reef; Straits of Florida from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge out 20 NM; Straits of Florida from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge 20 to 60 NM out; Hawk Channel from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge out to the reef; Bayside and Gulf side from Craig Key to West End of Seven Mile Bridge; Florida Bay including Barnes Sound, Blackwater Sound, and Buttonwood Sound; Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to south of Halfmoon Shoal out 20 NM; Straits of Florida from Ocean Reef to Craig Key 20 to 60 NM out; Gulf of Mexico from West End of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5 Fathoms; Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to south of Halfmoon Shoal 20 to 60 NM out; Straits of Florida from Ocean Reef to Craig Key out 20 NM; Hawk Channel from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to the reef
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 4 at 5:51PM EST by NWS Key West FL
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Hawk Channel and Straits of Florida from Ocean Reef to Halfmoon Shoal
out 60 nm...
Bay and Gulf Side from Craig Key to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5
fathoms...
Florida Bay including Barnes Sound, Blackwater Sound, and Buttonwood
Sound...

At 549 PM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists detected a
front, capable of producing wind gusts near 30 knots. This front was
located along a line extending from near Mosquito Point to 9 nm
southeast of Big Pine Shoal to 48 nm southwest of Wood's Wall West
Crack, moving east at 30 knots.

Locations impacted include...
Big Pine Shoal, Mosquito Bank Light, Tavernier Creek, Dump Keys,
Bonefish Tower, Wood's Wall East Crack and Tennessee Reef Light.

Prepare for squalls with winds quickly shifting west to northwest
and gusting near 30 knots, and locally rough and confused seas.

NWSheadline: FAST MOVING COLD FRONT TRACKING EASTWARD ACROSS FLORIDA KEYS WATERS
